1:
Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
\q
2:
"Can a man be useful to God?
\q Can a wise man be useful to him?
\q
3:
Is it any pleasure to the Almighty if you are righteous?
\q Is it gain to him if you make your ways blameless?
4:
Is it because of your reverence for him that he rebukes you
\q and takes you to judgment?
\q
5:
Is not your wickedness great?
\q Is there no end to your iniquities?
6:
For you have demanded guarantee of a loan from your brother for no reason,
\q and you have stripped away clothing from the naked.
\q
8:
although you, a mighty man, possessed the earth,
\q although you, an honored man, lived in it.
10:
Therefore, snares are all around you,
\q and sudden fear troubles you.
\q
11:
There is darkness, so that you cannot see;
\q an abundance of waters covers you.
12:
Is not God in the heights of heaven?
\q Look at the height of the stars, how high they are!
\q
13:
You say, 'What does God know?
\q Can he judge through the thick darkness?
\q
14:
Thick clouds are a covering to him, so that he does not see us;
\q he walks on the vault of heaven.'
15:
Will you keep the old way
\q that wicked men have walkedâ€”
\q
16:
those who were snatched away before their time,
\q those whose foundations have washed away like a river,
\q
17:
those who said to God, 'Depart from us';
\q those who said, 'What can the Almighty do to us?'
20:
They say, 'Surely those who rose up against us are cut off;
\q fire has consumed their possessions.'
22:
Receive, I beg you, instruction from his mouth;
\q store up his words in your heart.
23:
If you return to the Almighty, you will be built up,
\q if you put unrighteousness far away from your tents.
\q
24:
Lay your treasure down in the dust,
\q the gold of Ophir among the stones of the brooks,
\q
25:
and the Almighty will be your treasure,
\q precious silver to you.
28:
You will also decree anything, and it will be confirmed for you;
\q light will shine on your paths.
29:
God humbles a proud man,
\q and he saves the one with lowered eyes.
\q
30:
He will rescue a man who is innocent;
\q you will be rescued through the cleanness of your hands."
